snippet: President Mohamed Morsi of Egypt rescinded most of a temporary order elevating his authority but did not postpone a referendum on a draft constitution, a critical opposition demand.
abstract: Egypt's Pres Mohamed Morsi moves to appease his opponents by offering concessions and rescinding some power; comes hours after state news media reports that Morsi is moving toward imposing form of martial law to secure streets and allow vote on Islamist-backed draft constitution;  Morsi does not budge on postponing referendum, critical demand of opposition.
lead_paragraph: President Mohamed Morsi of Egypt rescinded most of a temporary order elevating his authority but did not postpone a referendum on a draft constitution, a critical opposition demand.

headline.seo: Morsi Extends Compromise to Egyptian Opposition
headline.main: Backing Off Added Powers, Egypt’s Leader Presses Vote
headline.print_headline: Morsi Extends A Compromise To Opposition

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
